name: Shangri-La China World Summit Wing Beijing

reviews.title: Luxury in the sky
reviews.text: You certainly get a birds eye view of the city from this hotel. Situated on the upper floors of one of the city's tallest buildings, you can survey the vastness of Beijing (that's if the pollution does not block it out completely - it's that bad at times). Arrival is a little disappointing, as the Reception and Lobby on the Ground Floor are more like an Office Block (which the rest of the building is). However, once you get up to the proper Reception on the 68th floor, the welcome is genuine and efficient. Guest rooms are large and well appointed, with everything you could possibly desire. Nespresso machines, iPod dock, complimentary WiFi and a big bathroom with lovely L'Occetaine amenities. Decor is austentatious luxury. A real stand out is the very well appointed gym and swimming pool - both with spectacular views (and equipment). The restaurant is also very good and there is a large lounge bar. Staff are courteous and helpful throughout. However there is an underlying theme that this is boring luxury. Yes, they've ticked all the boxes - but there is nothing memorable, or with an ounce of personality. With the views, they could have the best restaurant and bar in town - but bland is the polite word for what is on offer. This is a great hotel for visiting dignitaries and CEO's that don't look beyond the blacked out window of the limousine. If you are a real traveller, then maybe look elsewhere.

This hotel is perfect by its location, by its staff, by its view (in spite of the continuous smog), by its rooms.... Well by everything! It is the tallest building in Beijing, has a top bar with an amazing view, and the rooms are so, so, so good!!!! Always is a big pleasure to stay at any Shangri-la. They make you feel at home :)
reviews.title: A Shangri-la Hotel. Great view.

reviews.text: Despite the tremendous air pollution and poor visibility preventing you to take advantage of one one the reasons you choose this hotel, you will find enough reasons to rate with high marks this place. Of course when Shangri La is associated, you know you will be pampered and it is as always a symbol of high standard of service.
reviews.title: Fantastic place, despite the outside weather conditions!
Tremendous Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel has some really great people working for it and the accommodation is tremendous. They do the 5 Star things well like remembering your breakfast coffee order. In particular the red suited man on the ground floor who printed me out directions to a restaurant in another hotel 20 minutes away really did Shangri-la a good deed because I will remember it.
The hotel is not a walk to the main attractions but has a lot going for it.
reviews.title: Best in Beijing
Very good!
reviews.text: Very very kind staff. Very pleasure stay. Nice gym and nice pool. Only problem is a bit far from subway station and the mainly atractions. Restaurant Stay is a 5 star restaurant and absolutelly amazing!

This China World Summit Wing hotel is not to be confused with the older China World hotel nearby. When spoken in Chinese, its discernable although many cab drivers would still get confused - this is known as the "Guu Mao Da Jiu Dian" while the other is known as "Zhong Guo Da Jiu Dian" - to make it more confusing both are being operated by the Shangri La group. I was told by the doorman that the only drawback to the location was the lack of available cab drivers that knew how to get into the driveway proper - but everytime I stood out I did not have any issues getting a taxi within 10-15 mins. They had even advised me to wait indoors while they helped me to get a cab.
reviews.title: Lives up to its lofty expectations

reviews.text: I was dropped off at the office wing but no problem I cut through the block and was told the check in was on the 64th floor. The elevator was fast, very fast and it took less than 60 secs to reach the reception (I timed it). My check in was speedy and they helped me bring my luggage up to the 75th floor - which was a really good height looking over Chang An Street. The view on a good day (when Beijing is not covered in smog) is pretty astounding - I had a really good view after it snowed one day.
reviews.title: Elegant, refined and hype,all that in the center of Beijing

reviews.text: The hotel room was cosy, nothing less than what I would expect from a member of the Shangri La group, and I was able to adjust the temperature to suit me (it was snowing outside and about -6 deg C). Being a Jade member I had some amenities provided for such as coke, beer and cup noodles. The toilet and shower was also segregated which was a good touch for those staying with their other halves.
reviews.title: First class

reviews.text: Breakfast was on the 79th floor which is also open as a steakhouse in the evening - it was good but wasn't quite as good as the other Shangri La hotels I had been in Shanghai / Beijing - I guess I missed the open kitchen concept. However I was able to order my usual La Mian and omelettes if I wanted to.
reviews.title: Just a brilliant hotel in a brilliant location

reviews.text: I recently stayed on the 70th Floor on a business trip and I have to say this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. OK it is a shame about the well documented air quality in Beijing but once inside everything was fresh and very clean. The room was huge with a bathroom equally as big.
reviews.title: High and Mighty!
An oasis of calm in a city of chaos
reviews.text: I was very warmly greeted by Angela who was a real credit to the Hotel. I used the very well equipped gym twice during my stay and largely had the place to myself. The machines and free weights were all Life Fitness and in excellent condition, there was a very good swimming pool as well.
Food was overall very good, if a little pricey.
reviews.title: Meet my expectation for first class

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Beijing.
reviews.title: One of the best hotel I have ever lived....

reviews.text: I must preface this review by stating that I stayed at the hotel during one of the Capital's worst smog weeks. Despite not being able to see further than a few hundred metres from 80 stories up, it was a great hotel.
reviews.title: No better place to stay in Beijing

reviews.text: Stayed here for business in November for 3 nights. Wonderful hotel with all the facilities you would expect but with stunning views of Beijing included. Only issue was when I had a spa treatment the staff member wanted to escort me to my room as I changed from my suit and she was worried I would steal the coat hanger. Very insulting but not a true reflection of the hotel.
reviews.title: Stunning Business Hotel

reviews.text: Stay here often on business. Hotel is very new with state of the art facilities. Staff is very well good and quite responsive, especially when compared with other chinese hotels. As compared to the park Hyatt, which is also an excellent choice, the china summit wing is newer and closer to offices in the china world complex. It does not have a club in the same caliber as Xiu in the park Hyatt and also not as easy to get a taxi. Water pressure in the bathrooms of the summit wing also could be higher. Gym has great cardio equipment but the weights leave a bit to be desired.
reviews.title: Very efficient business hotel

reviews.text: Stayed on a business floor and was delighted with the check in. A staff member met me at the door, escorted me to my room & completed all the registration at the desk in my room.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: The check out was just as easy.
reviews.title: Almost at par with best HK/Sing hotels

reviews.text: Clean, quiet, efficient, friendly staff, great amenities, terrific views & a choice a outstanding restaurants.
reviews.title: a second visit......

aka: China World Summit Wing Hotel Beijing
description: China World Summit Wing, Beijing comprises 278 guest rooms and suites, four designer restaurants, two bars and a lounge. Accommodations with guest room sizes averaging 65 square metres are the most spacious in the city. The hotel also houses the city's highest spa retreat with CHI, The Spa - Shangri-La's signature spa brand - on level 77. Most of the city's attractions, such as the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, are within a 15-minute drive.
